About Me

My name is Adam, and I am a cybersecurity major and IT professional. Outside of work and school, I am a big gamer, I enjoy spending time with family and friends, and I am very ambitious when it comes to my career and the goals I have set for myself.

I did not grow up with a technical background, but I discovered my interest in IT and cybersecurity through my high schoolâ€™s magnet program. I spent two years studying networking and two years learning cybersecurity fundamentals, and during that time I realized that this field was not only interesting to me but something I genuinely enjoyed.

Once I figured that out, I started working toward building real experience. The summer after my junior year of high school, I earned my first internship as a Device Support Associate. I was quickly selected for a leadership role within the program and asked to support several projects throughout my time there. I also worked hard to earn industry certifications, including CompTIA Security +, which many students do not earn until late in college or several years into their careers.

By the time I entered college as a freshman, I already had four IT and cybersecurity internships, six certifications, and a strong foundation of practical skills. I am grateful for where that work has brought me, and I am excited for what comes next. I enjoy learning, improving, and gaining more real experience every chance I get.

Certifications

Industry certifications that validate my skills in cybersecurity, networking, and device support.

CompTIA Security+

CompTIA Security+

Validates core cybersecurity knowledge including risk management, network security, incident response, vulnerabilities, and securing enterprise environments.

Cisco CCST Cybersecurity

Cisco CCST Cybersecurity

Focuses on threat detection, security tooling fundamentals, log analysis, and defending networks against common attacks using foundational blue-team concepts.

Cisco CCST Networking

Cisco CCST Networking

Covers networking fundamentals, OSI/TCP-IP models, routing and switching basics, subnetting, and how data moves securely across modern networks.

Cisco CCST IT Support

Cisco CCST IT Support

Demonstrates strong help desk fundamentals, OS troubleshooting, hardware diagnostics, and end-user support workflows used in enterprise IT environments.

Lenovo Qualified PC Service Technician

Lenovo Qualified PC Service Technician

Training in Lenovo hardware diagnostics, teardown, component replacement, and warranty-compliant service procedures for enterprise fleets.

HP Service Qualification

HP Service Qualification

Covers HP hardware repair, imaging, device preparation, and OEM service standards used to support large-scale enterprise deployments.
